abstract: A structure that defines the available input and output port types.

# AVAudioSession.Port

**Structure**

A structure that defines the available input and output port types.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Port
```

## Getting Input Ports

- **builtInMic**: An input from a device’s built-in microphone.
- **continuityMicrophone**: An input from a Continuity Microphone on Apple TV.
- **headsetMic**: An input from a wired headset’s built-in microphone.
- **lineIn**: A line-level input from the dock connector.

## Getting Output Ports

- **airPlay**: An output to an AirPlay device.
- **bluetoothA2DP**: An output to a Bluetooth A2DP device.
- **bluetoothLE**: An output to a Bluetooth Low Energy (LE) device.
- **builtInReceiver**: An output to the speaker you hold to your ear when you’re on a phone call.
- **builtInSpeaker**: An output to the device’s built-in speaker.
- **HDMI**: An output to a High-Definition Multimedia Interface (HDMI) device.
- **headphones**: An output to wired headphones.
- **lineOut**: A line-level output to the dock connector.

## Getting I/O Ports

- **AVB**: An I/O connection to an Audio Video Bridging (AVB) device.
- **PCI**: An I/O connection to a Peripheral Component Interconnect (PCI) device.
- **bluetoothHFP**: An I/O connection to a Bluetooth Hands-Free Profile device.
- **carAudio**: An I/O connection through Car Audio.
- **displayPort**: An I/O connection to a DisplayPort device.
- **fireWire**: An I/O connection to a FireWire device.
- **thunderbolt**: An I/O connection to a Thunderbolt device.
- **usbAudio**: An I/O connection to a Universal Serial Bus (USB) device.
- **virtual**: An I/O connection that doesn’t correspond to physical audio hardware.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a new instance with the raw value you specify.

## Getting the Port Attributes

- **portName**: A descriptive name for the port.
- **portType**: The type of the port.
- **channels**: An array of channel objects that describe the port’s input or output channels.
- **AVAudioSessionChannelDescription**: A class that describes a hardware channel on the current device.
- **uid**: A system-assigned unique identifier (UID) for the port.
- **hasHardwareVoiceCallProcessing**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the associated hardware port has built-in processing for two-way voice communication.
- **isSpatialAudioEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the port supports spatial audio playback.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
